sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using QR decomposition:

2x + y - z = 8
-x + 3y + 2z = -11
3x - 2y + 5z = 29

Round your answer to two decimal places.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using QR decomposition, we first need to represent the system in matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables, and b is the column vector of constants.

A = |  2  1 -1 |
    | -1  3  2 |
    |  3 -2  5 |

b = |  8  |
    | -11 |
    |  29 |

Now, we perform QR decomposition on matrix A, where A = QR. Q is an orthogonal matrix, and R is an upper triangular matrix.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the orthogonal basis for the column space of A:

u1 = (2, -1, 3)
u2 = (1, 3, -2) - (1/7)(2, -1, 3) = (1/7)(3, 20, -13)
u3 = (-1, 2, 5) - (1/7)(2, -1, 3) - (5/49)(3, 20, -13) = (1/49)(-36, 5, 62)

Now, normalize the orthogonal basis to obtain the orthonormal basis:

q1 = u1 / ||u1|| = (2, -1, 3) / sqrt(14) = (1/sqrt(14))(2, -1, 3)
q2 = u2 / ||u2|| = (1/7)(3, 20, -13) / sqrt(194/49) = (1/sqrt(194))(3, 20, -13)
q3 = u3 / ||u3|| = (1/49)(-36, 5, 62) / sqrt(5341/49) = (1/sqrt(5341))(-36, 5, 62)

Now, we can form the Q and R matrices:

Q = | (1/sqrt(14))   (1/sqrt(194))   (1/sqrt(5341))(-36) |
    | (-1/sqrt(14))  (1/sqrt(194))(20) (1/sqrt(5341))(5)  |
    | (3/sqrt(14))  (1/sqrt(194))(-13) (1/sqrt(5341))(62) |

R = | sqrt(14)  (1/sqrt(14))(2)  (1/sqrt(14))(-1)  |
    |   0       sqrt(194/7)     (1/sqrt(194))(5)  |
    |   0         0             sqrt(5341/49)     |

Now, we can solve the system Rx = Q^Tb:

Q^Tb = | (1/sqrt(14))(2)   (-1/sqrt(14))(-1)  (3/sqrt(14))(1)  | |  8  |
       | (1/sqrt(194))(3)  (1/sqrt(194))(20) (1/sqrt(194))(-13)| | -11 |
       | (1/sqrt(5341))(-36)(1/sqrt(5341))(5) (1/sqrt(5341))(62)| |  29 |

Q^Tb = |  1.00 |
       | -1.00 |
       |  2.00 |

Now, we can solve the upper triangular system Rx = Q^Tb using back substitution:

R = | sqrt(14)  (1/sqrt(14))(2)  (1/sqrt(14))(-1)  | | x |   |  1.00 |
    |   0       sqrt(194/7)     (1/sqrt(194))(5)  | | y | = | -1.00 |
    |   0         0             sqrt(5341/49)     | | z |   |  2.00 |

Solving for x, y, and z, we get:

x ≈ 1.00
y ≈ 2.00
z ≈ 3.00

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is approximately x = 1.00, y = 2.00, and z = 3.00, rounded to two decimal places.
